content: confetti we all have that skein of yarn in our stash right the one that you saw at the local sheep and wool festival and just had to buy even though you had no idea what you wanted to use it for how about that yarn of the month club yarn that just hasn t made it out of your stash or the sock yarn that you fell in love with even though you don t knit socks and you know that it will pool like crazy in anything else i m guilty of stashing those skeins i see it and love it but i don t knit socks heck i don t ever wear socks unless i m going out to play in the snow with my kids so what to do with all of those fun color ways make confetti i designed this scarf on the fly with a beautiful skein of yarn that i got from witch candy yarns if you haven t heard of her or seen her yarn then you are missing out she is a genius she creates the most unique color ways that are always so much joy to create with this one here is called party like it s 6/26/15 it s is one that she dyes every year to celebrate the day that the supreme court approved the legalization of same sex marriage its fun and whimsical and playful and just down right cute i wanted to knit up an accessory that wrapped all of that into a simple project that was super easy to knit but not at all boring i think that i got it right so break out that crazy yarn and have some fun confetti scarf 1 designs by jennifer tipton 2019 materials needed abbreviations used one skein or approximately 400 yards/365 meters k- knit of fingering weight yarn in any color way that you p- purl love the sample was knit using one skein/400 kfb-knit front back yards of sock weight yarn from witch candy in her k2tog_ knit 2 stitches together color way party like it s 6/26/15 k3tog- knit 3 stitches together yo- yarn over us size 6/4mm circular needles with an 18 or 24 sl1-wyif- slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in front cable unless otherwise noted 1 locking stitch marker p1 tbl- purl 1 stitch though the back loop darning needle gauge 21 stitches and 40 row in 4 of garter finished size 63 from tip to tip and 15 deep from top edge to tip of point please read through all instructions before casting on in order to familiarize your self with the scarf s construction for this scarf you will be working sections of garter row followed by sections of stockinette with an eyelet row running through the middle until you reach the end where we ll finish up with a section of eyelets and a bobble bind off the scarf increases at an asymmetrical rate resulting in an increase of two
